metadata.dc:title: Nail injury in a seven-year-old girl, what to suspect?
metadata.dc:description: The nail changes in children are a common reason for consultation in primary care. The proper development of nails depends on various physiological processes, both local and systemic, so a large number of conditions can cause nail changes. During infancy, there are physiological differences on nails with adults. Knowing these physiological variations is essential for proper management. The case of a seven-year-old girl with nail lesions with nail pitting and striations is presented (AU)
metadata.dc:creator: Esteve Martínez, A
Morata Alba, L
Morata Alba, J
Messeger Badia, F
metadata.dc:source: Pediatr. aten. prim;19(73): 57-62, ene.-mar. 2017. tab, ilus
metadata.dc:title: Lesión ungueal en un escolar, ¿qué sospechar?
